page.title: 01Area around Pennan
page.content: The area consists of high pasture land with steep cliffs dropping to the sea. the area is sparsely populated with most people being farmers. The exception is the small harbour town of Pennan from which one lobster fisherman works. The old fishermen's houses are being renovated and most are being lived in permanently, some are used as holiday homes. These people work either in Fraserburgh or Banff. The primary aged chidren go to school in New Aberdeen, 3 miles away and will go to secondary school in Banff. People from surrounding towns use Pennan as a base watersports, water skiing, sail boarding, canoeing. Despite the population being small, approxiately 30, there is a good community spirit. A major film called 'Local Hero' was filmed in Pennan
